   @bkmgit The errors should be reproducible locally using the same docker command as in the CI job (don't forget environment variables), for example:
   ```
   UBUNTU=18.04 archery docker run -e SETUPTOOLS_SCM_PRETEND_VERSION="6.0.0.dev468"  ubuntu-cpp
   ```
   
   A prerequisite is to install [Archery](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/developers/archery.html).

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description: We should bump bundled third-party dependencies to newer versions as far as possible (some may not be compatible, e.g. the AWS SDK).

comments.body:
Possible updates are:
 * {color:#000000}xsimd [https://github.com/xtensor-stack/xsimd] {color}

 - Apache Thrift [https://thrift.apache.org/download]
 - Google Snappy [https://github.com/google/snappy/releases]
 - Google RE2 [https://github.com/google/re2]
 - RAPIDJSON [https://github.com/Tencent/rapidjson] - not updated, no releases in some time
 - Protobuf [https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf]
 - GRPC [https://github.com/grpc/grpc]
 - GLOG [https://github.com/google/glog]
 - C-ARES [https://c-ares.org/]
 - BOOST [https://www.boost.org/]
 - {color:#000000}AWS SDK [https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-cpp] {color}
 - AWS CHECKSUMS [https://github.com/awslabs/aws-checksums]
Should be yes, but it's just a mirror so it's not blocking this upgrade, correct?
Hmm, I cannot reproduce the issue with recent AWS SDK versions anymore, at least with the conda packages, so perhaps it can be bumped as well.

Would it be reasonable to defer this one _after_ the release? I think it would be good to have a bit more time to test the updated dependencies instead of pushing them out just a few days before a release
Indeed, I think it's more reasonable to defer this since we aim for cutting a first RC in a couple days.
Most recent version of AWS SDK, [1.9.123|https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-cpp/releases/tag/1.9.123] does not build correctly for all other test builds.
One needs to add at least [AWS-CRT-CPP|https://github.com/awslabs/aws-crt-cpp] which also replaces some of the other AWS packages and will continue to grow.

Latest release of Abseil ( LTS 20210324.2) seems like it might need C++17 [https://github.com/abseil/abseil-cpp/issues/819]  to avoid errors such as:

 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::numbers_internal::safe_strtou64_base(absl::lts_20210324::string_view, unsigned long*, int)' 
 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::numbers_internal::safe_strto64_base(absl::lts_20210324::string_view, long*, int)'

C++17 build seems to want to use abseil compiled with C++11:

 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::numbers_internal::safe_strtou64_base(absl::lts_20210324::string_view, unsigned long*, int)' 
 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::numbers_internal::safe_strto64_base(absl::lts_20210324::string_view, long*, int)' 
 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::numbers_internal::safe_strto32_base(absl::lts_20210324::string_view, int*, int)' 
 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::numbers_internal::safe_strtou32_base(absl::lts_20210324::string_view, unsigned int*, int)' 
 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::optional_internal::throw_bad_optional_access()' 
 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::ByChar::Find(absl::lts_20210324::string_view, unsigned long) const' 
 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::ParseTime(absl::lts_20210324::string_view, absl::lts_20210324::string_view, absl::lts_20210324::Time*, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char> >*)' 
 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::ParseCivilTime(absl::lts_20210324::string_view, absl::lts_20210324::time_internal::cctz::detail::civil_time<absl::lts_20210324::time_internal::day_tag>*)' 
 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::string_view::find(absl::lts_20210324::string_view, unsigned long) const' 
 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::strings_internal::CatPieces[abi:cxx11](std::initializer_list<absl::lts_20210324::string_view>)' 
 
/usr/bin/ld: debug/libarrow.so.600.0.0: undefined reference to `absl::lts_20210324::FormatTime[abi:cxx11](absl::lts_20210324::string_view, absl::lts_20210324::Time, absl::lts_20210324::TimeZone)' 
 
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
It may be better to update some of the dependencies in separate issues since they will each require some code changes due to interface changes.
